item.title: Meghan add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Meghan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of not having the courage to be an absolute nobody." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Meghan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "It's funny. All you have to do is say something nobody understands and they'll do practically anything you want them to." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Meghan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "An artist's only concern is to shoot for some kind of perfection, and on his own terms, not anyone else's." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Meghan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I’m just sick of ego, ego, ego. My own and everybody else’s. I’m sick of everybody that wants to get somewhere, do something distinguished and all, be somebody interesting. It’s disgusting." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "We gaze continually at the world and it grows dull in our perceptions. Yet seen from another's vantage point, as if new, it may still take the breath away." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's still magic even if you know how it's done." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meghan add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "The problems of the world cannot possibly be solved by skeptics or cynics whose horizons are limited by the obvious realities. We need men who can dream of things that never were." -- John Keats

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "First you jump off the cliff and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "So few want to be rebels anymore. And out of those few, most, like myself, scare easily." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Too late, I found you can't wait to become perfect, you got to go out and fall down and get up with everybody else." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "So that's my wish for you, and all of us, and my wish for myself. Make New Mistakes. Make glorious, amazing mistakes. Make mistakes nobody's ever made before. Don't freeze, don't stop, don't worry that it isn't good enough, or it isn't perfect, whatever it is: art, or love, or work or family or life." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Meghan add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "Sometimes, you have to step outside of the person you've been and remember the person you were meant to be. The person you want to be. The person you are." -- H.G. Wells

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "She sounds like someone who spends a lot of time in libraries, which are the best sorts of people." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "When you are born,” the golem said softly, “your courage is new and clean. You are brave enough for anything: crawling off of staircases, saying your first words without fearing that someone will think you are foolish, putting strange things in your mouth. But as you get older, your courage attracts gunk, and crusty things, and dirt, and fear, and knowing how bad things can get and what pain feels like. By the time you’re half-grown, your courage barely moves at all, it’s so grunged up with living. So every once in awhile, you have to scrub it up and get the works going, or else you’ll never be brave again." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "Wishes of one's old life wither and shrivel like old leaves if they are not replaced with new wishes when the world changes. And the world always changes. Wishes get slimy, and their colors fade, and soon they are just mud, like all the rest of the mud, and not wishes at all, but regrets. The trouble is, not everyone can tell when they ought to launder their wishes. Even when one finds oneself in Fairyland and not at home at all, it is not always so easy to remember to catch the world in it's changing and change with it." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "I don’t want to be a Princess,” she said finally. “You can’t make me be one.” She knew very well what became of Princesses, as Princesses often get books written about them. Either terrible things happened to them, such as kidnappings and curses and pricking fingers and getting poisoned and locked up in towers, or else they just waited around till the Prince finished with the story and got around to marrying her. Either way, September wanted nothing to do with Princessing." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "Some girls have to go to college to discover what they are good at; some are born doing what they must without even truly knowing why. I felt a hole in my heart shaped like a dark door I needed to guard." -- Catherynne M. Valente
